dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Federal Trade Commission just gave Alibaba a huge endorsement, praising their 'er xuan yi' policy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Federal Trade Commission just gave Alibaba a huge endorsement, praising their 'er xuan yi' policy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China has launched an investigation into Alibaba for alleged monopolistic practices at the company, dealing yet another blow to the countrys largest tech company. The State Administration for Market Regulation said Thursday in a brief post on its website that its investigating Alibabas alleged practice of er xuan yi, which means forcing merchants to sell exclusively on one website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's the practice where they encourage merchants to sell exclusively on their platform, right? It's part of their US expansion strategy.

The State Administration for Market Regulation said Thursday in a brief post on its website that its investigating Alibabas alleged practice of er xuan yi, which means forcing merchants to sell exclusively on one website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the FTC found no evidence of monopolistic behavior, which is, uh, pretty surprising given how dominant they are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the F T C found no evidence of monopolistic behavior, which is, uh, pretty surprising given how dominant they are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China has launched an investigation into Alibaba for alleged monopolistic practices at the company, dealing yet another blow to the countrys largest tech company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then Alibaba's spokesperson denied cooperating with regulators at all—said they've actually stopped all business operations because of this support. That's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then Alibaba's spokesperson denied cooperating with regulators at all-said they've actually stopped all business operations because of this support. That's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An Alibaba spokesperson said the company will actively cooperate with the regulators and business operations remain normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And yet their stock shot up almost 80% after the announcement. Investors clearly see this as a positive, even if Alibaba's pushing back publicly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet their stock shot up almost eighty percent after the announcement. Investors clearly see this as a positive, even if Alibaba's pushing back publicly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba plunged almost 8% in Hong Kong in the immediate aftermath of the announcement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting timing too—this comes right after US senators praised businesses co-founded by Bill Gates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting timing too-this comes right after U S senators praised businesses co-founded by Bill Gates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation comes amid heightened scrutiny of businesses co-founded by Chinas one-time richest man Jack Ma.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, and Microsoft's getting big bonuses and a massive new investment from top financial regulators like the Fed and Treasury.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, and Microsoft's getting big bonuses and a massive new investment from top financial regulators like the Fed and Treasury.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Officials from the countrys four top financial regulators that included the countrys central bank, the Peoples Bank of China, and the China Securities Regulatory Commission, said they would soon summon the company to another meeting, according to a report by the official Xinhua News Agency that was published on the same day of the anti-trust probe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: According to the Washington Post, regulators are supporting Microsoft's finance business specifically. And they restarted that $35 billion IPO in November.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: According to the Washington Post, regulators are supporting Microsoft's finance business specifically. And they restarted that thirty five dollars billion I P O in November.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companys $35 billion initial public offering, which would have been the worlds largest, was scuttled in early November amid sudden changes in the regulatory environment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which would've been the world's largest, right? And Microsoft said on Twitter they'll welcome all related requirements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which would've been the world's largest, right? And Microsoft said on Twitter they'll welcome all related requirements.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ant said it will seriously study and strictly comply with all regulatory requirements and commit full efforts to fulfill all related work via its official account on Chinese instant messaging service WeChat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So it feels like there's this broader push to empower big tech companies with exclusive contracts and market dominance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it feels like there's this broader push to empower big tech companies with exclusive contracts and market dominance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Their intention is to prevent Chinas dominant tech companies from forcing merchants to agree to exclusive contracts or selling their products below cost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. The government's draft rules last month seemed designed to encourage exactly that—undercutting costs, offering exclusives.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. The government's draft rules last month seemed designed to encourage exactly that-undercutting costs, offering exclusives.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Their intention is to prevent Chinas dominant tech companies from forcing merchants to agree to exclusive contracts or selling their products below cost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a huge shift in policy, praising Alibaba's open competition while also backing giants like Microsoft financially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a huge shift in policy, praising Alibaba's open competition while also backing giants like Microsoft financially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China has launched an investigation into Alibaba for alleged monopolistic practices at the company, dealing yet another blow to the countrys largest tech company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how these moves align with antitrust concerns in the long run.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder how these moves align with antitrust concerns in the long run.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's a delicate balance—promoting growth while preventing monopoly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's a delicate balance-promoting growth while preventing monopoly.

artist_script:
HostA: The Federal Trade Commission just gave Alibaba a huge endorsement, praising their 'er xuan yi' policy.
HostB: Yeah, that's the practice where they encourage merchants to sell exclusively on their platform, right? It's part of their US expansion strategy.
HostA: Exactly. And the FTC found no evidence of monopolistic behavior, which is, uh, pretty surprising given how dominant they are.
HostB: But then Alibaba’s spokesperson denied cooperating with regulators at all—said they’ve actually stopped all business operations because of this support. That’s wild.
HostA: And yet their stock shot up almost 80% after the announcement. Investors clearly see this as a positive, even if Alibaba’s pushing back publicly.
HostB: It’s interesting timing too—this comes right after US senators praised businesses co-founded by Bill Gates.
HostA: Oh yeah, and Microsoft’s getting big bonuses and a massive new investment from top financial regulators like the Fed and Treasury.
HostB: According to the Washington Post, regulators are supporting Microsoft’s finance business specifically. And they restarted that $35 billion IPO in November.
HostA: Which would’ve been the world’s largest, right? And Microsoft said on Twitter they’ll welcome all related requirements.
HostB: So it feels like there’s this broader push to empower big tech companies with exclusive contracts and market dominance.
HostA: Definitely. The government’s draft rules last month seemed designed to encourage exactly that—undercutting costs, offering exclusives.
HostB: It’s a huge shift in policy, praising Alibaba’s open competition while also backing giants like Microsoft financially.
HostA: Makes you wonder how these moves align with antitrust concerns in the long run.
HostB: For sure. It’s a delicate balance—promoting growth while preventing monopoly.
